Effective means\u2014doing the RIGHT job right.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nThe law of excluded alternative says that doing one thing means not doing something else\u2014as a deliberate choice. The lateral thinker calls this freeing up time so that there is always enough time to do the most important things. I with held this wisdom from the long haired as a matter of choice.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nImagine time management being done by a parcel chemical tanker on time charter or a team doing open heart surgery\u2014you get a general idea, what planning, preparation and OJT ( on the job training or mentoring ) is all about. Inadequate planning and preparation gives the illusion of too little time.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPr1utb2gI/AAAAAAAABE0/S1uIiQ0y0fA/s1600/images+%252816%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPr1utb2gI/AAAAAAAABE0/S1uIiQ0y0fA/s1600/images+%252816%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nTime is money. Time once lost can never be regained. Time which is irreplaceable and irreversible is a great leveller and treats all the same. Money is safeguarded. Same way time must be safe guarded. Time management is an attitude of accountability , flexibility and a dramatic re-ordering of priorities . A manager who cant manage his time is indeed a real asshole.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nI was recently ridiculed by a friend that workers from my home state of Kerala wasted 15% of their time by constantly hoisting up his lungi tying it up loosely which would require retying in another 10 minutes. ( you have to see this to believe this ) The paradox was \u2013yet the job was done better. The answer is while tying up his lungi again\u2014the workers mind was still working \u2013planning , conceptualizing and constantly assessing the overall progress. An Industrial Engineer would never understand this \u201c discretionary time\u201d water logic.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nTreat your senior managers as business partners\u2014not subordinates. Be pro-active. Time is lost by reacting un necessarily. Look forward \u2013not behind at the ships wake. Avoid travel by proper communication. Lack of communication is like cutting off blood supply to an organ\u2014it can cause gangrene. Your crew list is like part of your own body. Good upward and down ward communication is a must like the arteries and veins. Do not use walkie talkies or telephones to discuss sensitive subjects. Punish morons who keep falling into the same dang hole again and again.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPnJgtIloI/AAAAAAAABEA/wSZe8Ou2-SQ/s1600/images+%25282%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPnJgtIloI/AAAAAAAABEA/wSZe8Ou2-SQ/s1600/images+%25282%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nTime spent in reinventing the wheel is wasted time. Paperwork is a waste of time. Let your papers mature in a drawer before you file it. You will find that 95% of it is worth dumping. Do not us your box files as garbage bins. Destroy papers which have lost meaning and not required for audits and inspections. Avoid unnecessary CC and auto mailing lists. Have a good information retrieval system. Avoid duplication of work especially paperwork.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nLeveraging and enhancing time is the ability to accomplish greater quality and quantity in the same amount of time. Have written goals. Have an external memory white board on the bulkhead in front of your desk when your 24 hour goals are written in order of priority. This white board can be a great stress buster. Reorder your priorities often. Stress and insecurity makes a man defensive and lose creativity. Every ship I have commanded has such white board external memory in the master\u2019s day room.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nHave a book where your weekly plans are written down. Give category A or B priority and a dead line for the important ones. Delegate the low priority category D jobs without feedback.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nSolve all problems on the drawing board before it is done physically. Say a discharging plan or a dry dock list must have a BAR DIAGRAM HAVING TIME ON THE X AXIS. ONCE THE JOB STARTS THE BAR DIAGRAM MUST BE CONVERTED TO A RUNNING BAR DIAGRAM. This way you avoid biting off more than what you can chew and disaster commitments.. Have a quiet hour for planning every day. Your desk must be functional\u2014not just nice to look at, neatness signifies no great shit.\u2014with the pending work drawers within reach. To complete a job first begin.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nBust big problems into smaller ones\u2014like how the Japanese build ships in their village yards like Usuki using sub contractors. At least this busts the \u201cI don\u2019t know where to start from\u201d syndrome of procrastination. When there is no light at the end of the tunnel the best is to break up the work into smaller units. The sense of accomplishing one thing at a time will help you to stay in the drivers seat.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nA job is as simple as navigating across the ocean with limited fuel. Too often we get bogged down by the means and lose sight of the road. The shortest route need not be the fastest or fuel efficient route. The marathon man paces himself till he reaches the destination. He does not sprint burn himself out and then lie down on the CCR sofa with a Joan of Arc type expression on his face. Be the catalyst \u2013once you burn yourself out you have screwed up real good and will lose respect. ENERGY MANAGEMENT and time management is more or less the same if you think the lateral way.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nFatigue is a huge time waster leading to failure to deliver the goods. Self discipline, abstaining from trivia , concentrating on creative work, thinking in terms of objectives are the hall marks of productive managers. Hey! Does anybody care for hardworking managers who spin their wheels and burn spectacular rubber unnecessarily?.<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPnjR-6qmI/AAAAAAAABEE/ofxtgr538G8/s1600/images+%25284%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPnjR-6qmI/AAAAAAAABEE/ofxtgr538G8/s1600/images+%25284%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n&nbsp;Does anybody relate sweat on the brow to efficiency? Is there any need to convince others ( unless they are stupid ) and deliver the image that their leader works a lot.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nDC\u2014( digression code ) I remember an electrical officer who could not read a circuit diagram always having sweat on his brow\u2014tee hee.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nDo not get into the activity trap having lost sight of the larger picture---wherein the activity becomes an end in itself\u2014a false goal. You see such a thing quite often in a ships engine room. The extreme to this is a chief engineer who has brainwashed himself that the purpose of a ship is to take the engine room from point A to point B\u2014not to carry cargo and make money for its owner.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nKeep a small diary in your pocket to note down random thoughts and ideas when you are not at your desk\u2014or you may forget it like the fleeting dream of Sigmund Freud. Do not leave important thoughts that are essential to be remembered in the clutches of a unreliable memory.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPre5fr1dI/AAAAAAAABEw/J5rPiHfmxWE/s1600/images+%252815%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPre5fr1dI/AAAAAAAABEw/J5rPiHfmxWE/s1600/images+%252815%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nCreative time spent in planning, preparatory time spent in setting up, productive time spent in doing the job are all worth it. Overhead time spent in paperwork and reporting/ overlapping records is a time waster. And ALWAYS the length of a progress report is inversely proportional to the amount of progress. Time spent in planning is the biggest time saver. I must repeat--Don\u2019t put your hands into motion till you put your brain into gear.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nImagine a chief engineer and superintendent spending major part of their time on nonsense overheads. Imagine a superintendent constantly peeking into the emails of other ships not in his pool to update his curiosity or personal knowledge bank\u2014imagine a ships chief engineer having a similar facility to peek into the correspondence emanating from engine rooms of other ships!! Do I strike a familiar chord?</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nMove fast on reversible decisions and slower on irreversible decisions\u2014just like the open sea and a narrow channel navigation.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nPlay the ball\u2014don\u2019t let the ball play you. A small digression here. Recently I went for a dolphin show. It was THE perfect show. It was a revelation when I realised that it was the dolphin who was calling the shots on its own time table. Much before the trainer said \u201c jump\u201d the dolphin was already in the take off mode.<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPoEtg12MI/AAAAAAAABEI/z3z1zCwCQe8/s1600/images+%25285%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPoEtg12MI/AAAAAAAABEI/z3z1zCwCQe8/s1600/images+%25285%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n&nbsp;Lateral thinkers will sometimes allow the ball to play them\u2014which means letting loose the reins yet being in control. In my career as master many times I had escaped from grave difficulties by applying this method. Allowing a non ice class ship to find its own way to the Belledune berth in heavy pack ice after getting a lead or allowing the ship to find the centre of the mud swamped channel enroute to Rosario in the La Plata river or surfing the icy storm north of Aleutian chain ( oops! Must not reveal all mE secrets and be burnt on the stake by the non comprehenders )</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nHandle only exceptional problems. Do not be relegated to the job of communication boy\u2014especially in an emergency. I do remember being in the TESMA conference room with a fire raging on Sigloo Espoo\u2014with the master giving a pathetic running commentary on air\u2014instead of command and control.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nAvoid holding meetings ( especially unnecessary ones ) in prime time\u2014when everybodys energies are at a peak. Make meetings count. Nobody should depart after a meeting feeling frustrated that it was a waste of time. A meeting cannot be a ceremony where people give each other what they want , politically lying to each other and getting zilch done.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nMeet visitors outside your office and converse there.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nWork on your ability to recover from interruptions. Learn to live with interruptions. Treat every one on its own merit.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nDelegate down wards. Don\u2019t let parasite cum middlemen subordinates do upward delegation . Imagine a master working for the incompetent chief officer and not vice versa--- a scene at Fukuoka shipyard on North Contender.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nAvoid perfectionism. Wisdom consists of knowing when to avoid perfectionism. More often perfectionism is nothing but an ego trip\u2014so spake Osho.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nLearn to say NO to anything that is not the best use of your time. But be available to your staff when absolutely needed. Imagine a master NOT going up on the bridge when required by the officer on watch.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nKeep your waste paper basket well fed. Trivia accumulates fast. Ask yourself this question as you toss the paper\u2014what would be the WCS ( worst case scenario) if this paper was consigned to the waste bin ?</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPrH11DxJI/AAAAAAAABEs/gKp3eeDD3qk/s1600/download2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPrH11DxJI/AAAAAAAABEs/gKp3eeDD3qk/s1600/download2.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nTo complete a job\u2014first begin. It takes greater energy to start than to sustain. The unfinished business will act as a stimulus to continue. Unstarted work holds no such catalysis. Setting deadlines is to kick start people to start. Once you have started, have the wisdom and flexibility to change. Inability to stop is called compulsive. Ever heard of a compulsive drinker? TIME MANAGEMENT IS THE ABILITY TO START , CHANGE AND STOP THE TIME CYCLE\u2014cyclic time is different from linear time\u2014like machinery running hours of CSM.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nSo then what are the time wasters? Travel, crisis management and fire fighting, muncipality type red tape, incompetent staff, excessive turn over ( somebody humming the tune of --please release me let me go\u2014for I don\u2019t love you any more ), involvement in routine and the mundane, making unnecessary progress reports and sitreps.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nPen your goals. Pen and paper force you to be clear and precise \u2013even to yourself. Work on your mental ability to handle projects and multitask jobs.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nHandle paperwork at the maximum twice. Keep incoming papers in a drawer to mature. File only stuff worth filing.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nDelegate as much as possible and exact accountability. Train crew towards independent , unmonitored action. Delegate skilled tasks to the right people. You should figure out who are the masons and who are the architects in your crew list. Don\u2019t give the mason an architects work and vice versa. And don\u2019t let a mason convince you that he is an architect and vice versa--This way you don\u2019t spend time on undoing. Asking dumb questions takes lesser time than correcting dumb mistakes.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nCoffee breaks for crew must be long enough to give brief relaxation\u2014not to just gulp down hot coffee and rush back.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPoh3bdCGI/AAAAAAAABEM/ocR8ly2Wvaw/s1600/images+%25286%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPoh3bdCGI/AAAAAAAABEM/ocR8ly2Wvaw/s1600/images+%25286%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nMarlon Hontomins ( reverse delegator of Mutiny on the Conty fame ) first law for the vertical thinkers ---the sooner you fall behind\u2014the more time you have to catch up.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nHontomins Second law: The slower you worketh the fewer mistakes you shall maketh.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nHontomins Third law: The more proficient one is at procrastination\u2014the less competent you need to be in your work.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nHontomin\u2019s legacy: the STUPID shall inherit the earth and its mineral rights.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nNow you know why a certain Capt Bligh gave him the boot.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPo3QvCp3I/AAAAAAAABEQ/a5dqvnj_1mA/s1600/images+%25287%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPo3QvCp3I/AAAAAAAABEQ/a5dqvnj_1mA/s1600/images+%25287%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nTIME MANAGEMENT IS LIFE MANAGEMENT. When you work with turkeys forget about the happiness of soaring with the condors ( condor is the great wingspan Californian eagle ).<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPpNX5z7qI/AAAAAAAABEU/4bODActCwNk/s1600/download+%25281%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPpNX5z7qI/AAAAAAAABEU/4bODActCwNk/s1600/download+%25281%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nHappiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing and LOVE WHAT YOU ARE DOING and doing it well. You must get a feel that you make a difference in the world you are in. Set peace of mind as your top goal and organize your time around it. There is a certain amount of self respect, self esteem , personal pride, enthusiasm and positive mental attitude you can squeeze out of effective time management. Check out the energy you derive from working smarter rather than working harder. Feel the spring in your step\u2014the confidence you radiate.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nLateral thinking is about starting with the end in mind and crisis anticipation. Crisis anticipation is termed negative attitude by vertical thinkers using the left lobe for whom fall back plans are a huge waste of time.The theory of constraints say that there is a bottleneck for every project\u2014how do you circumvent or rather pulverize this time honoured and \u201cnot so inadequate\u201d bottleneck?</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPq0g-b9FI/AAAAAAAABEo/RJyIO0ty6sE/s1600/images+%252814%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPq0g-b9FI/AAAAAAAABEo/RJyIO0ty6sE/s1600/images+%252814%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nControl the sequence of events to get the best ROTI\u2014returns on time invested ( this is different from the roti you have in mind \u2013tee hee ). Leveraging time means doing only the most important things in the available time. This means the worst use of time to do perfectly well what need not be done at all. This usually happens to the turkeys who lose the larger picture. ( I hope SPMCT does not clap on to me \u2013society for prevention against mental cruelty to turkeys )</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nYou could use money to save time ( not buy it )\u2014this is the essence of outsourcing done by multinational companies\u2014basically it boils down to delegation to a company whose overheads and hourly rates are lower than yours.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nLook closely at the Yankee law of success---FAKE IT TILL YOU MAKE IT . Before you succeed your must first portray that you are successful. Same way for time management. First visualize and portray yourself as a good time manager\u2014well organized and effective\u2014and wait for the magic results.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nEvery meeting must have a clear written agenda and a deadline. Start the meeting on time. Assume the late comers wont come. Persistent latecomers MUST feel your heat. For this discipline yourself to be punctual. When you put deadlines you force and energise the system. President Abdul Kalam calls such energizing \u201cigniting minds\u201d \u2013 just a misnomer\u2014one of the rare occasions the missile man misfired.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nLateral thinking is about reorganization\u2014continiously seeking better, faster and more effective ways to accomplish the same result. World records are being continuously broken due to such lateral thinking in training. Jumping greater heights using Fosbury Flip is an example.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nF1 racing pits law: DO THINGS RIGHT THE FIRST TIME EVERY TIME. This means zilch mistakes\u2014zilch time lost in undoing. Organize and simplify the work. There is no perfectionism here \u2013it is all about every being perfectly in order before the F1 car comes into the pit.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPqeLMJ0fI/AAAAAAAABEk/aAiDKgWAAvs/s1600/images+%252813%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPqeLMJ0fI/AAAAAAAABEk/aAiDKgWAAvs/s1600/images+%252813%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nLaw of delegation: even when you delegate fully without feedback\u2014order of priority of tasks must be in your hand.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nLateral thinking is about \u201cback to the future\u201d thinking. Project forward a few years and look backwards. You need long term vision combined with short term focus.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nBRAINSTORMING is used to identify all possible causes of a problem before you decide on a solution. The quantity of brainstorming matter you will be quite surprised to discover will decide the quality of your solution. Aaha\u2014quality based on quantity? Well this is called anticipatory thinking. A collision is heavy traffic is all about failed anticipatory thinking.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nSpend some time every day to upgrade your skills and hone your intellect with food for thought.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPp2w8DuNI/AAAAAAAABEY/9TJ-wNAKteE/s1600/images+%25289%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPp2w8DuNI/AAAAAAAABEY/9TJ-wNAKteE/s1600/images+%25289%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nThe lateral thinking person can hold two contradictory thoughts and still continue to function. He uses mental flexibility as a time management tool. He has the character to admit easily \u201c I changed mE mind\u201d</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nStaying in the wrong company with wrong people around you is a time waster.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nA short nap in the afternoon after a heavy lunch is a key time management tool. Treat this time as a recharging battery time. If you have to avoid this nap\u2014eat lightly to keep your mind sharp and clear for the entire post lunch session. Going to bed early when you are tired is an excellent use of time\u2014for you are recharging your only spent battery which is meant to keep you going .</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPqPbRRTwI/AAAAAAAABEg/QlfgPP4-iP8/s1600/images+%252812%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPqPbRRTwI/AAAAAAAABEg/QlfgPP4-iP8/s1600/images+%252812%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nDo not allow television to be a bad master.--- during working hours, barge in into the crew and officers mess un announced once in a while .</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nEver practiced COMPLETION BY DELETION?\u2014of low value nonsense jobs, passed on to you by some turkey\u2019s nonsense observation list?\u2014 remember my cynical response and dumping of Caltec inspection list of a certain John Bull.?. Simplifying your life is all about eliminating unnecessary tasks and activities.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nSpeed reading and speed typing are major time savers. I do know a couple of old masters who take 10 times more time to read or type a page of email than an average guy. If his command of queens English is purrely pedestrrrian then he might need a dictionary to go along with his chore. This reminds me\u2014once my Russian chief officer asked me accusingly \u201c Kaapthan \u2013why you no spik intherrrnationaal englisshh??\u201d this type English is the subtitle you find in Hollywood movies pirated Russian CD\u2014coined by some Russian for fellow Russians.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nAfter reading all above --Like the longhaired dude--- if you are indeed overwhelmed with too much to do with too little time \u2013it pays to remind yourself\u2014</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nALL YOU CAN DO --- IS ALL YOU CAN DO. ( something like\u2014when you got to go, you got to go ) for after all you are human not a superman.&nbsp;</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nAltas could hold the whole world on his head \u2013but could not hold his own-- SH#T .</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPqBz3XUeI/AAAAAAAABEc/H52-PXYDcbA/s1600/images+%252811%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPqBz3XUeI/AAAAAAAABEc/H52-PXYDcbA/s1600/images+%252811%2529.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nCapt Ajay Prasad or Capt Sanjay Mehta or Capt Anshuman Jain will remember that this was the only piece of wisdom I gave him when handing over 4 stripes to them.</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 14px;\"><i>You will never find time for anything. If you want time you must make it. - Charles Buxton</i></span></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOrh4cNKD4I/AAAAAAAAAns/B27ZC1aybOs/s1600/TIME.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"628\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOrh4cNKD4I/AAAAAAAAAns/B27ZC1aybOs/s640/TIME.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "114", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/144882647292132183/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "287883965003588084", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2010-11-22T22:18:00+05:30", "updated": "2010-11-30T00:33:56+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxMjkxMDU3NDM2OTA5Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/11/change-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/287883965003588084", "title": "CHANGE -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOqes5dBu1I/AAAAAAAAAng/Ttl2DjlY1Pw/s1600/chan.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOqes5dBu1I/AAAAAAAAAng/Ttl2DjlY1Pw/s1600/chan.jpg\" /></a></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOqe2f_0_DI/AAAAAAAAAnk/smvXxiCpHo8/s1600/CHANGE.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOqe2f_0_DI/AAAAAAAAAnk/smvXxiCpHo8/s1600/CHANGE.JPG\" /></a></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">CHANGE -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Let me start off with 2 true anecdotes\u2014</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">ONE\u2014</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">The foot soldier scout ran in foaming from the mouth and breathless to the General\u2019s tent and screamed \u201c SirrrJee, we have been surrounded from all directions!!\u201d</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">\u201cExcellent\u201d cried the visibly relieved General ( well- known for his mighty valor and non- existent brains ) jumping up from his chair and twirling his waxed moustache . \u201c We shall attack in all directions !!!\u201d.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Digression: This poor General\u2019s promotion was blocked after a furore caused by his comment in a seminar on Strategy for Change . \u201c In Mahabharat, Dushasan should have stopped pulling the endless sari of Draupadi and lifted it up instead!!\u201d . After that incident where he was nearly lynched by his own soldiers, he developed a phobia when it came to stretching his brains.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">TWO---</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">In the 1983 World Cup semi-finals , Team India were tottering at the brink of defeat against Zimbabwe with all the batsmen back at the pavilion . The Captain of the team Kapil Dev ( essentially a pace bowler ) waded in into the field , smote the cricket ball in all directions , sent the hapless opposition on a leather hunt , scored a stupendous 183\u2014a world record\u2014and took India to an astonishing victory. After the match \u2013at the mandatory press conference , the inevitable question was posed about \u201chow he handled the tremendous pressure and what was his strategy\u201d. The world was all ears for a few pearls of wisdom which could possibly sway future MBA and Business School management methods \u2013the way Lalu Prasad Yadav has done recently with Indian Railways . Now, a Cricket game is not won by skills alone, the thinking cap of the Captain is all important. Kapil retorted \u201cwhat preyyure! ( read that as pressure ) no preyyure!! \u2014he did not think! , he just swung just his bat in all directions\u2014 le dhannnadhun de dhanndun.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Aaha! Now I have your attention---</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">This piece is based on my experiences as a Master of ships in EMS starting from Sichem Pearl, behind a mouse pushing desk at EMS Singapore office often doing coaching interviews, and recently on board a new acquisition Stainless Steel Chemical tanker Sichem Copenhagen as a Manager of Change \u2014(where I took my scalar wave EM howitzer along , switched on psychotronic mode\u2014just in case the pseudo resistors made me miss my deadlines\u2014)</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Digression:--Sceptics , please go to Google search and punch in \u201cscalar waves\u201d and see how many million hits you gets. Scalar waves emitted by Uri Geller in Gorbachov\u2019s head caused Perestroika and the disintegration of the mighty Soviet empire, Sai Baba uses Scalar waves on his teeming millions -- The Third world war will be won with psychotronic war fare, scalar waves and EMPs\u2019.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">All those who identify with the mindless dhannadun approach ---must now stop reading this NOW\u2014lest they overheat their grey matter and fall into a tizzy. This piece on CHANGE is solely for the thinkers who has made this world a better place to live in.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">A thesis would be too long\u2014what I have presented is a few tips.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Darwin said that it is not the species with the greatest strength nor the one with the highest intelligence that survives, but one that is most adaptable to change ( cockroaches are adaptable , poor extinct dinosaurs were not ) . This is as true of all businesses, including shipping, as it is to living things, if new customer demands are ignored or not taken seriously.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPurvNZ4PI/AAAAAAAABFA/sfU5L3yqUtY/s1600/images.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPurvNZ4PI/AAAAAAAABFA/sfU5L3yqUtY/s1600/images.jpg\" /></a></div><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change is the only constant we live with. It has been&nbsp;continuous&nbsp;since the beginning of time. 98% of all knowledge has been accumulated in the last 50 years\u2014think about it.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change today happens very fast. It is a way of life today and is an ongoing process. Our lives are filled with both predictable and unpredictable transitions. Traditionally change was a short burst of disruption followed by a long plateaus of stable operations. Today there are no longer any rest periods, change is continuous and enormous. The innovators change first, the diehards change last. The people who cannot change are the \u201ccasualities of war\u201d.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Without careful management, change can become a business nightmare, when new structures and processes are imposed without enough forethought. Change then becomes an unfocused, indefinite time of turmoil. Having started without direction and continued without focus or competent monitoring, it ends with a whimper when those involved can go no further. There is a limit to the number of storeys you are going to add to your outdated skyscraper. Every business which wants to grow must understand growing pains. Growth can lead to problems if the organization is not set to cope up with ways of doing things, that were perfect at the time it was created \u2013 but grossly inadequate or inappropriate later on.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change management is a new skill. The ability to manage change is an essential skill for all decision makers. I have been long advocating including this subject in our EMS seminars , so far only Risk Management has been forth coming.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change encourages innovation . There is a difference between creativity and innovation. Creativity looks at options and generates ideas. Innovation takes an idea and develops it into a practical application. Innovation requires some change in behaviors, processes and functions.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPwZ1hANNI/AAAAAAAABFE/oNG8guWDGVM/s1600/images+%25281%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPwZ1hANNI/AAAAAAAABFE/oNG8guWDGVM/s1600/images+%25281%2529.jpg\" /></a></div><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">It is no big secret that the most successful companies proactively look for opportunities to change rather that it being forced upon them. Proactive action reinforces the impression of control and understanding. This can restore faith in the organizations collective ability and willingness to change and motivate people for further change and improvement. Caution can look like weakness and indecision. Proactive change is characterized by seeking out reasons for change rather than waiting for them to arise. Major benefit of changing proactively is that you have more time-- one of the key secrets of Time Management. Planning in advance gives you much more flexibility over options, priorities , resources and time scales. At the extreme of reactive change is to respond to a crisis situation. In a well managed business most internal crisis should be known before they occur. Resist the temptation to view persistent problems as isolated incidents.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">What are the symptoms for the need for change\u2014creative people instead of generating ideas and revenue are wasted in firefighting--people spending quality time working around impractical business systems, low morale, innovative ideas not being generated, culture at odds with what is required for the business environment. Managers who lack the skills and perspectives to move forward are literally the arsonists who are guilty of lighting fires. Such individuals interpret business culture to meet their own selfish needs. If you cure symptoms rather than the causes, then the change effort is a quick fix that fails to address what is really troubling the business. The reason for change needs to be presented in order to generate commitment to the change effort</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">In the brilliant book \u2013Who moved my cheese\u2014Dr Spencer says\u2014</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">CHANGE will happen</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">anticipate change</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">monitor change</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">adapt to change quickly</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">enjoy change</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">be ready to change again and enjoy yet again</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPwt8Za6SI/AAAAAAAABFI/f8dQ2RYoPc0/s1600/images+%25282%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPwt8Za6SI/AAAAAAAABFI/f8dQ2RYoPc0/s1600/images+%25282%2529.jpg\" /></a></div><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">In my vision for the next century I see that all shipping companies will include a para in their company policies about willingness to change --- and proactively change again if things do not work out \u2013about keeping up the ante , looking for constant evolution and new change opportunities to take advantage of ----to be farsighted and to give a strategic orientation towards change-- to have a culture that is based on action, not statements of intent or lip service\u2014to gain mastery over change and avoid being its victim, so that the company shapes its future rather than Change bending the company out of shape.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Now what is a vision?</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">A vision is a clear idea for the future that acts as a fulcrum for all change efforts. Vision is a sense of how it will look when it works . It should not be a management fantasy, slogan or platitude. Good visions act as useful guides and inspiration. Use your mind to envision the outcome of change. Vision makes you aware of the opportunities of change and helps release your energy. Personal vision acts as an anchor during change. As we become more change hardy, our stability comes from the inside and outside changes become less disruptive. It is important to imagine as positive a vision as you can. The way our minds work is that our actions tend to follow our thoughts. If you see a dim unattractive future vision, you are more likely to end up in that situation. That is why in gymnasiums they keep posters of muscular guys like Arnold Schwartznegger and not our big bottomed and tuft tittied Bollywood heroes of yester year .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPxC674yFI/AAAAAAAABFM/5eoCcPZ_6kQ/s1600/images+%25283%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPxC674yFI/AAAAAAAABFM/5eoCcPZ_6kQ/s1600/images+%25283%2529.jpg\" /></a></div><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span><br />\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Be careful of what you imagine ( or wish for ) it just might just come true. You can be honest with yourself and have negative visions because you don\u2019t have enough information or resources. Don\u2019t stay stuck\u2014reach out. Promote desired outcomes by internal programming of vision. Re frame, look at the situation differently, see challenge, see opportunity, go around limits. Obstacles to change have to be confronted rather than accepted if change has to succeed. Many of the extraordinary things ordinary people achieve begin with a vision that inspires and empowers them.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Even re branding say from TESMA to EMS, is a major change. Re branding without any effort to make even a subtle change is such a waste of a rare opportunity. An internal culture that starts out as a key strength can if not changed when the time is right end up being a supremely powerful constraint on the business . The owner/ Charterer is increasingly expecting more, vetting inspectors are splitting hairs--\u2014this is not the time to be inward and backward looking. Check out what invisible or cultural factors are keeping the company where it is. Remember, the drivers for change come from outside the business while drivers for stability come from within. Generating awareness of the need to change involves shifting the focus to outside the business or seeing yourself as others see you. Every business which wants to grow must understand growing pains.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change can look risky\u2014gambling valuable resources when the need to conserve them is paramount. Doing nothing is always a low risk option. To avoid having a car accident, don\u2019t go for work\u2014sit at home and pray!. Delaying change for a while and carrying out with business as usual can seem appealing. Inaction will have its grave consequences. Every organization will have complacent managers who are essentially time servers who bed down for the long haul to retirement and who will fight change tooth and nail. They will be centered around the business culture of conservatism and risk aversion.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Some companies long history of success made people complacent , and no introspection was made to sense the urgent need for change\u2014like the Scindias who were in a general dry cargo fantasy world of dunnage and hessian separation cloth. Major changes to an organizations culture requires people to let go of of how it was and move through a period of doubt and uncertainty. It is no longer possible to remain a caretaker set in your sweet ways.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Creative people will quit if they are unable to find a rewarding role for themselves within the business. In any case many good people would rather leave a sinking ship\u2014 if they are financially vulnerable and have themselves and their families to take care of, after all charity begins at home. Today's lives are less predictable. There are no companies left where a parcel chemical Master (who has the sword of first foot failure dangling above on his head, and who is judged by his last singular performance ) , can expect to receive his gold watch.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPxsO5B2tI/AAAAAAAABFQ/wHVTNCUmuYc/s1600/images+%25284%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPxsO5B2tI/AAAAAAAABFQ/wHVTNCUmuYc/s1600/images+%25284%2529.jpg\" /></a></div><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change is as much about people as it is about plans.. Deal with change as a matter of heart as well as the head. The knock on effects of sweeping technological changes has to be weathered. Basic values may change\u2014a company that once valued strict procedures and tradition may shift towards valuing independence and new vistas. There has to be less hands on control, and more bridging.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">At EMS the Master\u2019s 6 monthly review must have a compulsory para about \u201cchange\u201d\u2014 a review is not about Masters pointing out spelling mistakes in company manuals and revision number errors. Change experiences must be rolled out to the organization as a whole by means of news letters and seminars. Reward communication and knowledge sharing between ships, departments and teams. Change provides an excellent opportunity to rethink job descriptions to make them more meaningful. Procedure manuals have to be rewritten, operations have to be revamped.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Flat structures while useful in enabling innovation may bring problems in terms of a fragmented culture or even a conflict between team loyalty and company loyalty\u2014say--Tech 2 vs Tech 3.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Crisis mentality can make good change management very difficult. Hence the reason we like predictive maintenance instead of breakdown maintenance on chemical tankers. The desire to find a solution quickly moves the emphasis from long term strategic thought to short term tactical solutions that may harm the future of the business. The need for swift focused unambiguous action makes it more likely that change will be non participative. The heat of the moment can make big bang transformational changes more appropriate that what they really are.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Formal education is increasingly in need of constant updating. Big companies now retrain their workers every 3 years because their previous skills become terribly obsolete. The tech skills learnt at college or on the job become obsolete, no set of skills stay useful forever during change Making changes work for you will require learning, being open to new directions and knowing how to say hullo and goodbye to positions and situations professionally. It is more important to understand how to learn than to know a particular set of skills.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Their culture is based on action, not statements of intent or lip service. A 21st century manager is a tight rope artist who keeps the business running smoothly through the change process , balancing the need for radical change with the necessity for continuity.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPx3yvbngI/AAAAAAAABFU/KqtqMze_orc/s1600/images+%25285%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPx3yvbngI/AAAAAAAABFU/KqtqMze_orc/s1600/images+%25285%2529.jpg\" /></a></div><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Anticipating change means you can position yourself to be ready for new developments before they happen, so that decisions are based on facts not comfortable assumptions. Focus on those at the sharp edge of the business to remove any barriers or buffers that may evolve between decision makers and competitive realities.&nbsp; Avoid focusing solely on internal realities which can often reinforce existing ideas , instead look to the outside world. Change is the catalyst for new directions.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Sextants, Morse , Nories tables and typewriters have given way to DGPS ,Inmarsat and Bluetooth computers . Digression:-- In the British parliament they still resist change--they still stand up at unstable GM for a second to cry \u201c hear hear\u201d and fall back in a heap on to their antique dull green plastic seats\u2014lest his neighbour steals his elbow space\u2014tee hee .</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPyJWyhg_I/AAAAAAAABFY/-ryAJzW-dKc/s1600/download.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TPPyJWyhg_I/AAAAAAAABFY/-ryAJzW-dKc/s1600/download.JPG\" /></a></div><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change can cover a broad spectrum. It can be unexpected, sudden, unsettling especially if new technology is introduced or it can be welcome and planned. Many traditional standards of security in the workplace are disintegrating. I remember the state of an old radio officer when a pioneer Satcom C was first fitted on my ship\u2014he had one cursory glance at the bulky MS DOS book which came along free , started sweating, and nearly fainted\u2014thinking he will have to mug up the whole book. In the past security came from not taking chances or rocking the boat. Now paradoxically security comes from being at the edges . Create your own security by being in touch with the change. Creative people determine their own security. An effective response to change involves several skills and some new attitudes.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Managing change is no frivolous task , it is very complex. A qualified and respected Change Manager has to make critical inputs into change planning, continuity planning and the process of embedding change. Such a culturally significant change anchor may have a decisive influence over the way change is perceived by others. People approach them to seek reassurance on the viability of change and their buy in is crucial. If he does not buy in the other wont either\u2014say Passivity meter over Palladium chloride.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">If the change is driven by executive ego of holy cows --not business need , this ego powered change wont last. Remember, time spent on change cannot be spent on real work\u2014something I discovered the hard way on Sichem Copenhagen , while I was the Manager of Change. Fast big bang changes are called creative destruction\u2014we have this vetting to do , make the change happen el pronto!! The cost of creative destruction by concentrating uncertainties into a short time frame can be very high in human terms . The change process can end up being so traumatic . \u2013the operation was a grand success \u2013but excuse please\u2014the patient died.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change is stress less only for the mindless. Change planning must be rooted in reality. Many change efforts fail because the Change Manager was not realistic about the constraints and obstacles that threaten change. Too often companies invest considerable time energy and money in making a good decision about what to change. And that is it!!!. They think their good deed is done. Hey, what about some investment to building involvement and commitment to that nice decision. Short sharp shock changes however effective will not build commitment for future change. Change should therefore be a normal part of management rather than an exceptional situation. The world does not fear a new idea. What it fears is a new experience. This can affect your your emotions especially your feelings about yourself. Change demands energy. Hours of worry will drain your energy.</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"querybold\"><span style=\"color: black;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Change is uncomfortable as we stop having same thoughts and feelings\u2014 we&nbsp;&nbsp;stop making the same chemicals which sends the body into a state of homeostatic imbalance. We do not feel like the same person again. Our body wants to identify with known associations.. it tries to influence the brain to return to a recognizable state of being so that the body can recalibrate itself with past feelings.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\"><br />\n</span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;\">Leaders evolve processes and attitudes that withhold information from the troops , partly to magnify their own perceived importance, for knowledge is power . Or it could be partly because of a sense that a little learning is a dangerous thing. But once people have the power that comes from knowledge they can use it to support change. It is a matter of trusting people to make the right choice. Once when I had to revive an unconscious (chemically) victim on deck , the second mate came a cropper\u2014it was the Cook who could administer the Oxygen resuscitator.
