Because the world will then know how India managed(survive/thrive) its civilizations through milleniums(yugas).... There is an avatar of vishnu yet to come ...</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: x-small;\"></span></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c2398522767974295058\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom: 0px; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_23.html?showComment=1551068652251#c2398522767974295058\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 25, 2019 at 9:54 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nTRILLIONS OF WORDS HAVE BEEN WRITTEN IN BOOKS AND INTERNET ABOUT THE \"SOUL\"..<br />\n<br />\nHAS ANYBODY GOT IT RIGHT TILL TODAY ?..<br />\n<br />\nWHY ?.<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL TAKES THE \"UNBEATEN PATH\" ALWAYS.. I AM FAMOUS FOR THIS..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nI WAS THE FIRST TO PREDICT EL NINO WEATHER -- AND WENT AHEAD WITH MY OWN PERSONAL POLICIES DESPITE ALL THREATENDENDEDING TO BITE MY HEAD OFF.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/02/el-nino-and-la-nina-mariners-overview.html</span><br />\n<br />\nMY SUCCESS RATE ( 100% ) CAUSED MY DETRACTOR BOSSES TO KEEP QUIET WHEN I CREATED NEW PERSONAL POLICIES ON MY SHIP WHEN IT CAME TO SAFETY.. THEY KNEW THAT CAPTAIN CANNOT BE WRONG -- HE HAS FIGURED OUT EVERYTHING..<br />\n<br />\nA DECADE BEFORE \"RISK ASSESSMENT\" VENTURED OUT TO SEA , I WAS ALREADY DOING IT AND SENDING SIGNED PROCES VERBAL COPIES OF \"MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE AND SAFETY COMMITTEE MEETING \" TO THE COMPANY..<br />\n<br />\nI ONLY TALKED ABOUT COMING SHADOWS.. ALWAYS BOATS IN FRONT OF MY SHIP WHICH POSED IMMINENT DANGER -- NEVER HARMLESS BOATS IN THE WAKE ...<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/04/dynamic-risk-assessment-on-chemical.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">DOES ANY PERSON ON THE PLANET HAVE THE BALLS TO WRITE A POST LIKE WHAT IS BELOW?..</span></b><br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/america-caused-global-warming-with_9.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">YES-- THIS IS THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL AND THE REST OF THE PEOPLE ON THE PLANET--&nbsp; PAST/ PRESENT/ FUTURE..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nAM I BOASTING ?<br />\n<br />\nSO BE IT !<br />\n<br />\nNEVER BEEN DELUDED BY A NAKED EMPEROR SITTING ON A THRONE.. BOTH HE AND ME \"SIT ON OUR FUCKIN' MOOLADHARA ASSES \"..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: x-small;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: x-small;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c3896902337518330936\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/03/india-must-revert-to-organic.html?showComment=1553100087996#c3896902337518330936\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">March 20, 2019 at 10:11 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nPEOPLE START BLOGSITES<br />\n<br />\nAFTER THREE MONTHS THEY KNOW THAT NOBODY IS GONNA READ THEIR BLOGS<br />\n<br />\nSO MANY OF THEM USE THE WORD \"VADAKAYIL\" FOR SEO<br />\n<br />\nIT WORKS FOR SOMETIME<br />\n<br />\nBUT THEN READERS WHOM THEY ATTRACT LEAVE THEM SOONER THAN LATER --THEY ARE NOT INTERESTED IN POISON..<br />\n<br />\nSOME OF THE SLIMY ONES THEN CREATE SEVERAL FAKE ID-- LITERALLY ONE PERSON TALKS AND REPLIES..<br />\n<br />\nBUT THEN YOU CANNOT CHANGE THE LANGUAGE FORMAT ...<br />\n<br />\nONCE ON A SCI SHIP MY MUSLIM TAMILIAN PURSER MADE MISTAKES IN THE ACCOUNTS-- HE WAS TOO GOOD TO MAKE SUCH MISTAKES<br />\n<br />\nSO I CALLED HIM AND SAID \" TELL ME WHAT IS BOTHERING YOU\"..<br />\n<br />\nAFTER SOME ARM TWISTING HE SAID -- IN HIS VILLAGE IN TAMIL NADU THEY HAVE SEVERE DROUGHT..IT WAS A LEATHER TANNING VILLAGE AND GROUND WATER WAS POLLUTED .<br />\n<br />\nSO I SAID-- LET ME APPLY FOR YOUR FAMILY TO COME ON BOARD ..A WIFE, A 13 YEAR OLD DAUGHTER AND A 8 YEAR OLD SON..<br />\n<br />\nHE SAID --THE SCI PERSONNEL DEPT HAS SOMETHING AGAINST HIM ( PROBABLY DUE TO AN ADVERSE REPORT BY SOME PREVIOUS CAPTAIN ) AND THEY WONT ALLOW HIM FAMILY CARRIAGE.. HE HAD TRIED IT BEFORE AND FAILED..<br />\n<br />\nSO I TOLD HIM-- GET YOUR FAMILY ON BOARD .. THIS IS MY SHIP.. I RULE HERE.. IN TWO WEEKS SHIP WILL BE AT CHENNAI..<br />\n<br />\nSO HE BROUGHT HIS FAMILY ON BOARD WHEN THE SHIP WENT TO CHENNAI..MY 6 YEAR OLD SON HAD COMPANY.. IN ONE MONTH FLAT HE MASTERED URDU AND NAMAZ.. HE USED TO DO NAMAZ WITH THE MUSLIM KIDS..<br />\n<br />\nSO I TOLD THE CHIEF STWEARD A GOAN CATHOLIC.. DONT PUT THE PURSERs FAMILY IN THE VICTUALLING LIST.. I WILL TAKE PERMISSION ( I WAS BLUE EYED BOY ) IN BLACK AND WHITE SOON ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE MOMENT THE CHIEF STEWARD HEARD THIS--THE BASTARD WROTE AN ANONYMOUS LETTER TO THE FLEET PERSONNEL GM.<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE FP GM GOT THIS LETTER HE SENT IT TO ME --THE ORIGINAL-- AND TOLD ME FIND OUT WHO THIS BASTARD IS AND DEAL WITH HIM..<br />\n<br />\nSO I ASKED FOR THE MENU REGISTER WHICH HAD THE CHIEF STEWARDs DAILY HANDWRITING -- AND ASKED MY GOAN CATHOLIC CHIEF OFFICER , RADIO OFFICER AND MY WIFE-- TO CHECK IF THE HANDWRITING MATCHES.<br />\n<br />\nAFTER 15 MINUTES --THEY SAID UNANIMOUSLY--THE ANONYMOUS LETTER HAS DIFFERENT HANDWRITING.. NOT ONE ALPHABET MATCHED..<br />\n<br />\nSO I ASKED THEM-- LOOK FOR DOUBLE LETTERS --LIKE COFFEE -- FF IS A DOUBLE LETTER<br />\n<br />\nWITHIN 30 SECOND THEY CHORUSED -- YES, CHIEF STEWARD IS THE BASTARD .. HE CHANGED SINGLE LETTERS - BUT DOUBLE LETTERS HE IGNORED..<br />\n<br />\nHOW I HUNG THE BASTARD BY HIS BALLS IS ANOTHER MATTER..<br />\n<br />\nI HAD THE SIGNED AND STAMPED PERMISSION FOR THE PURSERS FAMILY IN THE SAME ENVELOP-- BUT I DID NOT SHOW IT TO HIM.. I TOLD HIM -- COMPLAIN AGAIN , THIS TIME TO THE MD OR PRESIDENT OF INDIA....<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</span></span>\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: x-small;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: x-small;\">CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: x-small;\">..</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 5px;\">\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "42", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/513165614507290878/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "4938892925694375139", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2010-11-22T09:25:00+05:30", "updated": "2010-11-22T17:58:57+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxMjkwNDI4OTM3NTQ1Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/11/vegetable-oils-and-fats-on-chemical.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/4938892925694375139", "title": "VEGETABLE OILS AND FATS ON  CHEMICAL TANKERS -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOno5RC0waI/AAAAAAAAAlc/G4DLXTB5-fA/s1600/CAPT+VADAKAYIL.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOno5RC0waI/AAAAAAAAAlc/G4DLXTB5-fA/s320/CAPT+VADAKAYIL.jpg\" width=\"198\" /></a></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p><br />\n</o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p><br />\n</o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p><br />\n</o:p></span></div><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOnpc93qTzI/AAAAAAAAAlg/EzugikCkZMA/s1600/DSCI0139.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"133\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TOnpc93qTzI/AAAAAAAAAlg/EzugikCkZMA/s320/DSCI0139.JPG\" width=\"320\" /></a></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><b><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">&nbsp;VEGETABLE AND PALM OILS ON CHEMICAL TANKERS-- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></b></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The vegetable oil trade represents close to 60 million tonnes.&nbsp;&nbsp;It is 1/3 of the chemical tanker trade.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">High melting point palm oils like&nbsp;palmitic&nbsp;acid,&nbsp;stearic&nbsp;acid , fatty acids etc must never be allowed to freeze in the cargo pipelines. Discharging high MP palm oils in cold freezing weather requires clear action plan\u2014in case&nbsp;</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">of barge change over, for efficient sweeping etc.&nbsp;&nbsp;Cargo inside the pipelines must be immediately blown down hill ( trim ) before it freezes.&nbsp;</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Sweeping high MP palm oils heated to high&nbsp;dischg&nbsp;temperature requires close supervision . Sweeping equipment and waders must be kept in readiness and tank dry surveyor must be available to declare when enough is enough.&nbsp;&nbsp;Remember once the cargo falls below the level of steam coils things must happen the way it is desired, before it solidifies.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">When vessels are carrying solidifying products it is important that the products are at the maximum discharge temperature (or slightly above) at least one week prior to arrival at the discharge berth. Also during this period once the product is up to required temperature, soundings must be made in each tank using a rod and line to determine if there are any solid products on the tank bottom.<br />\n<br />\nIn addition, any ballast in double bottom tanks beneath the cargo tanks must be lowered so that there is no direct contact between the ballast and the cargo in adjacent tanks. If there&nbsp;isn&nbsp;a suction pit under the impeller of the&nbsp;deepwell&nbsp;pump, there is every chance that the impeller is stuck---in which case the pit ( cold pocket ) may have to be steamed from underneath.<br />\n<br />\nThe Internationally recognised heating instructions for the various products are as follows, the product should be up to the maximum temperature indicated at least seven days before arrival. Following is just a guide line as shippers will give clear heating requirements for voyage heat and discharge heat.<br />\n<br />\n<i><u>Product</u>&nbsp;<u>Voyage Temp&nbsp;</u></i></span><i><u><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">\u00b0</span></u></i><i><u><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">C</span></u></i><i><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">&nbsp;<u>Disch&nbsp;Temp&nbsp;</u></span></i><i><u><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">\u00b0</span></u></i><i><u><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">C</span></u></i><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n<br />\nCrude Palm Oil 32/40 50/55<br />\nNeutralised Palm Oil 32/40 50/55<br />\nNeutralised Bleached Palm Oil 32/40 50/55<br />\nRBD&nbsp;Palm Oil 32/40 50/55<br />\nNBD&nbsp;Palm Oil 32/40 50/55<br />\nCrude Palm&nbsp;Olein&nbsp;25/30 32/35<br />\nNeutralised Palm&nbsp;Olein&nbsp;25/30 32/35<br />\nNeutralised Bleached Palm&nbsp;Olein&nbsp;25/30 32/35<br />\nRBD&nbsp;Palm&nbsp;Olein&nbsp;25/30 32/35<br />\nNBD&nbsp;Palm&nbsp;Olein&nbsp;25/30 32/35<br />\nCrude Palm&nbsp;Stearin&nbsp;40/45 60/65<br />\nNeutralised Palm&nbsp;Stearin&nbsp;40/45 60/65<br />\nNeutralised Bleached Palm&nbsp;Stearin&nbsp;40/45 60/65<br />\nRBD&nbsp;Palm&nbsp;Stearin&nbsp;40/45 60/65<br />\nNBD&nbsp;Palm&nbsp;Stearin&nbsp;40/45 60/65<br />\nPalm Acid Oil 42/50 67/72<br />\nPalm Fatty Acid Distillate 42/50 67/72<br />\nCrude Palm&nbsp;Kernal&nbsp;Oil 27/32 40/45<br />\n<br style=\"mso-special-character: line-break;\" /> <br style=\"mso-special-character: line-break;\" /> </span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><u><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">PALM OIL ABBREVIATIONS:</span></u><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">CPO/ crude palm oil</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">NPO/ neutralised</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">B/ bleached</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">RD/ refined ,&nbsp;deodourised</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">L/&nbsp;olein</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">S/&nbsp;stearin</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">A/ acid</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">FD/ fatty distillate</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">K/ kernel</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">LC/ low colour</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">DF/ double fractionated</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">ME/ methyl ester</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">IV/ iodine&nbsp;valuse</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">PU/ poly unsaturated</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">In case of palm oils sudden rise of temperatures due to indiscriminate heating can cause release of&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;and make cargo off spec.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Acid value: AV is the number of&nbsp;&nbsp;grams of&nbsp;KOH&nbsp;required to neutralise 1 kg of product.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span lang=\"EN\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">FFA: AV is generally twice the&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;number.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">FATTY ACIDS:<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">ALIPHATIC (&nbsp;oleic,&nbsp;palmitic&nbsp;,&nbsp;stearic&nbsp;),<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">AROMATIC (&nbsp;phenyl&nbsp;stearic&nbsp;),<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">AMINO ACIDS<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Risk assessment form prior sweeping cargo\u2014wrt oxygen deficiency, burns to crew, and toxic/ health&nbsp;&nbsp;dangers<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">VEG OIL CARRIAGE<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Three types of deterioration can occur in oils and fats<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><u><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Oxidation</span></u><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><u><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></u></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Contact of oils and fats with oxygen, present in the atmosphere, causes chemical changes in the product which downgrade the quality. Much can be gained by reducing the amount of air contact . Oxidation proceeds more rapidly as temperature increases, so each operation should be carried out at the lowest practicable temperature. The rate of oxidation is greatly increased by the catalytic action of copper or copper alloys, even when trace amounts (ppm) are present. Because of this, copper and copper alloys must be rigorously excluded from the systems--seals, valves,&nbsp;&nbsp;strainers, pumps, temperature gauges or in sampling apparatus. Prolonged contact with mild steel can also cause oxidation.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">To prevent aeration-- It is preferable to clear the pipe line leading to the tank by a \u201cpigging\u201d system and/or by the use of inert gas. However, if air is used, a suitable means must be provided to prevent it being blown into the oil in the tanks.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">H<u>ydrolysis</u><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The breakdown of fats to fatty acids is promoted by the presence of water particularly at higher temperatures. Hydrolysis is also promoted by the action of certain micro-organisms. Tanks in which the oil is being stored or shipped should always be clean and dry before use.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><u><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">FFA</span></u><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">FFA&nbsp;of certain heating cargoes cargoes will increase if the moisture content is too high. Veg and animal oils have different&nbsp;SG&nbsp;at different levels after long storage.&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;of the layer closest to the coils increases faster and cause damage to the bottom\u2014so&nbsp;recirc&nbsp;&nbsp;Vegetable oil and Animal oil in coated cargo tanks. Advantages are less manual labour for squeezing after discharge&nbsp;&nbsp;and not allowing a difference in the&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;content between the lower and upper levels in the tanks.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Fat is combined with&nbsp;glycerine&nbsp;and fatty acid. When the fat is hot , it get decomposed to&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;and<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">glycerine&nbsp;( hydrolysis ). Increase of&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;means the cargo will become worse in quality. The quality<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">of vegetable oils and animal fats is largely determined by their AV acid value. A fresh oil or fat has<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">low AV. Parcels having different&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;shall not be commingled .Rapid heating results in increase<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">in&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;content or discolouration of the cargo.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Vegetable oil and Animal oils have a FREE FATTY ACID content (FFA).If hot&nbsp;prewashed&nbsp;FFA&nbsp;will increase rapidly to a level, which will coagulate the albumen in the Vegetable/Animal oil. This damages the surface of the zinc silicate lining.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><u><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Contamination<o:p></o:p></span></u></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Undesirable contamination may be from residues of a previous cargo or sea water . Previous cargoes not on the&nbsp;&nbsp;Lists of Acceptable or Banned cargoes are only to be used if agreed upon by competent authorities of the importing countries.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">HEATING:<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">All ships should be equipped with temperature sensors and control devices to prevent overheating of oil in the tank and associated lines.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">In temperate and cold climates, pipelines used for oils and fats which may solidify at ambient temperatures should preferably be lagged and also provided with heating, for example by steam tracing lines or electrical heating tape. When clearing pipelines in such climates, steam may be used.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Heating should start at a time calculated to give the required pumping temperature without ever exceeding the maximum rate of 5\u00b0C over a 24 hour period<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">To prevent excessive crystallisation and solidification during short-term storage and shipping, oil in bulk tanks should be maintained within the temperature ranges given in Table 1.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The temperatures apply to both crude and refined oils in each grade.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The temperatures are chosen to minimise damage to the oil or fat. Some crystallisation will occur, but not so much as to require excessively long heating before delivery. Thus palm oil stored at 32\u00b0C - 40\u00b0C will require about three days heating at 5\u00b0C over a 24 hour period to bring it to transfer temperature. Long term storage of all soft oils should be at ambient temperature and heating should be completely turned off. If the oil then becomes solid, extreme care should be taken during the initial heating to ensure that localised overheating does not occur.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Temperature at loading or unloading should refer to the average of top, middle and bottom temperature readings. Readings should be taken not less than 30 cm away from the heating coils.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Under cold weather conditions discharge temperatures should be at the maximum of those shown in Table&nbsp;&nbsp;to prevent blocking of unheated pipelines<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Where a number of products are transferred through a common pipeline system, the system must be cleared completely between different products or grades. The order of loading and discharge should be carefully chosen to minimise adulteration.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The following principles should be observed:<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Fully refined oils before partly refined.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Partly refined oils before crude oils.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Edible oils before technical grades.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Fatty acids or acid oils should be pumped last.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Special care should be taken to prevent adulteration between&nbsp;lauric&nbsp;oils and non-lauric&nbsp;oils.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The first&nbsp;pumpings&nbsp;of each grade should be collected where possible in separate tanks for quality checks<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">TEMPERATURES DURING STORAGE, TRANSPORT, LOADING AND&nbsp;DISCHARGE</span></b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></b></div><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"0\" class=\"MsoNormalTable\" style=\"margin-left: 7.5pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div></td>   <td colspan=\"2\" style=\"padding: .75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt; width: 143.25pt;\" valign=\"top\" width=\"191\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">45<o:p></o:p></span></div></td>   <td style=\"padding: .75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt; width: 79.5pt;\" valign=\"top\" width=\"106\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">55<o:p></o:p></span></div></td>   <td style=\"padding: .75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt; width: 43.5pt;\" valign=\"top\" width=\"58\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">55<o:p></o:p></span></div></td>   <td style=\"padding: .75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt; width: 65.25pt;\" valign=\"top\" width=\"87\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">65<o:p></o:p></span></div></td>  </tr>\n</tbody></table><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Notes</span></b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Hydrogenated oils can vary considerably in their slip melting points, which should always be declared. It is recommended that during the voyage, the temperature should be maintained at around the declared melting point and that this should be increased prior to discharge to give a temperature of between 10\u00b0 C and 15\u00b0C above that point to effect a clean discharge.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">It is recognised that in some cases the ambient temperatures may exceed the recommended maximum figures shown in the Table.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">FOSFA&nbsp;HEATING INSTRUCTION:<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Shippers shall ensure that the temperature of the oil during delivery into the tank(s) of a<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">ship is that at which the oil is usually handled and where heat is applied that the<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">temperature in no case exceeds that given in the appropriate table.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Master shall supply to cargo receivers a statement showing the cargo temperature at<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">loading and a chart on which the daily temperatures after loading have been recorded.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The charts hall be signed by the Master or authorized officer.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Shippers shall supply the following instructions with regard to heating of oil during the<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Voyage for ship's tanks fitted with heating coils :--<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">1.On completion of&nbsp;&nbsp;loading ship's steam coils shall be completely covered with oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">2.Heating shall be effected by hot water or, where this is impracticable by low pressure<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">saturated steam. Pressures shall not exceed 1 .5 bar gauge.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">3.During the voyage the oil shall be maintained in accordance with the temperatures set<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">out in the Heating Recommendations.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">4.In sufficient time prior to arrival at port of discharge heat shall be applied gradually to<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">ensure that the temperature of the oil at time of discharge is in accordance with the<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">temperatures set out in the heating recommendations&nbsp;&nbsp;The cargo shall be maintained<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">within this range of temperatures throughout the discharge.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">5.ln&nbsp;order to avoid any damage to the quality of the oil it is essential that heat is applied<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">gradually . A sudden increase in temperature must be avoided as it will almost certainly<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">result in damage to the oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">6.The increase in temperature of the oil during any period of 24 hours shall never exceed<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">5'C.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">7.As far as practicable top and bottom temperature shall be maintained at equal levels;<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">the difference between these two temperatures shall never exceeds 5 deg C.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">8.The temperatures referred to above are the average of top, middle and bottom readings.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The top reading shall be taken at about 30 cm (one foot) below the surface of the oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The bottom readings shall be taken:<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">In tanks which have bottom coils at 30 cm (one foot) above the level of the coils;<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">In tanks which have side coils but no bottom coils, at a point about two feet (60<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">c) from the bottom of the tank and about 30 cm (one foot) from the side coils.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">9.The temperature indicated in 4 above are applicable under normal conditions ruling<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">at port of discharge.&nbsp;ln&nbsp;the event of abnormal conditions( such as extremely low air or<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">water temperatures) receivers either directly or through their appointed representatives,<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">may vary the temperatures stated and instruct shipowners or their agents accordingly.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Details of any such variations shall be duly recorded and advised to shippers or their<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">representatives&nbsp;&nbsp;If there is more than one receiver of the oil ex one ship's tank:<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">All receivers from that tank should be in agreement to the proposed variations in<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">the temperature stated in 4 above;<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Shipper's representatives at port of discharge shall endeavour to reconcile<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">requirements of the individual receivers.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The&nbsp;<b>acid value</b>&nbsp;of an oil may be used as a measure of quality. However, the acid value of the oil must not be too high, as this denotes an excessively high content of free fatty acids, which causes the oil to turn sour. Discoloration may also occur.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Oils and fats spoil by readily becoming rancid. Rancidity is promoted by light, atmospheric oxygen and moisture and leads to changes in odor and taste. Thus, the tanks&nbsp;&nbsp;must be filled as full as possible, taking into consideration the coefficient of cubic expansion&nbsp;&nbsp;so that as little&nbsp;ullage&nbsp;space as possible is left above the cargo. Do not load rancid oil, since it does not meet quality requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">If the oil solidifies in the tanks, it cannot be liquefied again even by forced steam heating. In the vicinity of the heating coils, the oil melts, scorches, discolors and becomes rancid.<br />\n<br />\nPumping out may be difficult in cold weather. The oil may cool too rapidly in the long lines and solid deposits form on the outer walls, which cannot be pumped out and prevent the still liquid cargo from reaching the suction valve. This problem can be solved by appropriate voyage heating. Chill haze (separation) begins if cooling causes the temperature of the oil to approach solidification point, the oil becoming ointment-like and finally solid, such that it is no longer&nbsp;pumpable.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">All fats and oils have a particular density (approx. 0.9 g/cm<sup>3</sup>). With a rise in temperature, however, density diminishes, thereby leading at the same time to an increase in volume. This behavior is described by the coefficient of cubic expansion and is known as thermal dilatation.<br />\n<br />\nThe coefficient of cubic expansion amounts to: g = approx. 0.000746\u00b0C<sup>-1</sup><br />\n<br />\nAs a rule of thumb, oils may be expected to increase in volume by 1% of their total volume for each 14\u00b0C temperature increase<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Fats and fatty oils are insoluble in water. However, contact with water may give rise to soluble lower fatty acids and glycerol, which cause rancidity together with changes in color (yellow to brown), odor and taste as well as gelling and thickening. For this reason, the tanks must be absolutely dry after cleaning<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Ventilation must not be carried out under any circumstances, as it would supply fresh oxygen to the cargo, which would promote oxidation processes and premature rancidity.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Before anybody enters an empty tank for squeezing , it must be ventilated and a gas measurement carried out. Oxidation processes may lead to a life-threatening shortage of O<sub>2</sub>.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Of considerable significance with regard to tank cleaning is the&nbsp;<b>iodine value</b>, which is a measure of how strong a tendency the oil has to oxidation and thus to drying. Drying is particularly detrimental to tank cleaning, as the oil/fat sticks to the walls and can be removed only with difficulty. On the basis of&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.tis-gdv.de/tis_e/misc/trocknun.htm\"><span style=\"color: black; text-decoration: none;\">drying&nbsp;capacity</span></a>, oils are divided into nondrying,&nbsp;semidrying&nbsp;and drying oils.&nbsp;Drying&nbsp;oils have&nbsp;&nbsp;iodine value &gt;130 while non drying oils/ iodine value have Iodine value less than100<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\nWith an iodine value of 118 - 144, sunflower oil is a drying oil, which means that it is subject to severe drying on contact with atmospheric oxygen, so considerably complicating cleaning of the tanks. In addition, considerable weight losses sometimes occur.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Drying ,&nbsp;semidrying&nbsp;vegetable oils and animal oils ( or if you are in doubt )&nbsp;&nbsp;must be cold&nbsp;prewashed&nbsp;assoon&nbsp;as possible after discharge&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></i></b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">. A thin drying oil film like&nbsp;soyabean&nbsp;absorbs oxygen from air and polymerises to form a tough elastic film.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The drying ability is expressed by its iodine number. Non drying oils have least capacity for iodine. It is a measure of saturation.&nbsp;Unsaturation&nbsp;of veg oils range from 78% for safflower to 10% for coconut oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Examples of drying oils are\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Soyabean&nbsp;oil,&nbsp;saffloweroil, tall oil,&nbsp;tung&nbsp;oil, linseed oil, mustard seed oil,&nbsp;poppyseed&nbsp;oil, walnut oil etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></b></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"></span><b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">OXIDATIVE&nbsp;AND&nbsp;HYDROLYTIC&nbsp;RANCIDITY OF VEG OILS</span></b></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in; margin-left: .5in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in; margin-left: .5in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in; margin-left: .5in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Chang<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">e</span>s<span style=\"letter-spacing: 3.5pt;\">&nbsp;</span>in&nbsp;<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.3pt;\">&nbsp;</span>quality&nbsp;<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.1pt;\">&nbsp;</span>of&nbsp;<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.3pt;\">&nbsp;</span>the&nbsp;<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.2pt;\">&nbsp;</span>fats&nbsp;<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.2pt;\">&nbsp;</span>and&nbsp;<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.3pt;\">&nbsp;</span>oils&nbsp;<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.25pt;\">&nbsp;</span>during ship<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">m</span>ent<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.15pt;\">&nbsp;</span>o<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">c</span>cur<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.35pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"letter-spacing: -0.05pt;\">d</span><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">u</span>e<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.4pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">t</span>o<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.5pt;\">&nbsp;</span>h<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">y</span>d<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">r</span>olys<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">i</span>s<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.05pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">a</span>nd<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.4pt;\">&nbsp;</span>ox<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">i</span><span style=\"letter-spacing: -0.05pt;\">d</span>at<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">i</span><span style=\"letter-spacing: -0.05pt;\">o</span>n<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.1pt;\">&nbsp;</span>a<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">n</span>d<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.4pt;\">&nbsp;</span>this<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.4pt;\">&nbsp;</span>loss<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.4pt;\">&nbsp;</span>in<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.5pt;\">&nbsp;</span>quality<span style=\"letter-spacing: 2.25pt;\">&nbsp;</span>is ta<span style=\"letter-spacing: -0.05pt;\">k</span>en<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">&nbsp;</span>into<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.1pt;\">&nbsp;</span>acc<span style=\"letter-spacing: -0.05pt;\">ou</span>nt<span style=\"letter-spacing: style=\"letter-spacing: 1.65pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">h</span>ydro<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">c</span>arbo<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">n</span>s.<span style=\"letter-spacing: 1.3pt;\">&nbsp;</span>Further<span style=\"letter-spacing: 1.75pt;\">&nbsp;</span>removal<span style=\"letter-spacing: 1.7pt;\">&nbsp;</span>of<span style=\"letter-spacing: 1.95pt;\">&nbsp;</span>the<span style=\"letter-spacing: 1.9pt;\">&nbsp;</span>prot<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">e</span>ins<span style=\"letter-spacing: 1.65pt;\">&nbsp;</span>is<span style=\"letter-spacing: 1.95pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">a</span>ch<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">i</span>ev<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">e</span>d<span style=\"letter-spacing: 1.6pt;\">&nbsp;</span>at this<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.5pt;\">&nbsp;</span>step.<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.55pt;\">&nbsp;</span>The<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.65pt;\">&nbsp;</span>deodo<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.1pt;\">r</span>ization&nbsp;of<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.65pt;\">&nbsp;</span>edib<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">l</span>e<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.4pt;\">&nbsp;</span>fats<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.55pt;\">&nbsp;</span>and<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.55pt;\">&nbsp;</span>oils<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.55pt;\">&nbsp;</span>is<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.65pt;\">&nbsp;</span>accomplished<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">&nbsp;</span>by<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.6pt;\">&nbsp;</span>d<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.05pt;\">i</span>stillation.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in; margin-left: .5in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 3.05pt;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">SQUEEGEING&nbsp;AND PUDDLING</span></b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">&nbsp;</span></b><b><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">&nbsp;</span></b></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">It may be necessary to \u201csqueeze\u201d (sweep) the cargo tanks, especially when carrying Vegetable and Animal Oils. This will involve personnel (either from the vessel or ashore) entering the cargo tanks to assist by manual means (squeegees etc) to maximize the&nbsp;outturn&nbsp;of cargo.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Most animal and vegetable oils undergo&nbsp;decomposition, this process, known as&nbsp;putrefaction, generates obnoxious and toxic vapours and deplete the oxygen in the tank. Tanks that have contained such product must be properly ventilated and the atmosphere tested prior to tank entry. This is especially important prior sending personnel into the tank for sweeping purposes.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">In addition to&nbsp;putrefaction, certain oils like coconut coil can have hazards associated with the production of Carbon Monoxide (CO). These dangers are heightened during heating and the final stages of discharge when CO levels have been known to reach in excess of 3,000ppm. As a result, it is essential that before entering a tank for either \u201csqueezing\u201d the last remaining cargo or for tank cleaning that the following precautions are taken.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The atmosphere of the tanks is monitored regularly throughout discharge for the presence of CO.&nbsp;Temperatures&nbsp;should also be taken as excessive temperatures will assist in the production of CO.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The eight-hour safe exposure limit for CO is given as ,&nbsp;&nbsp;30PPM&nbsp;&nbsp;although short-term exposure (15 minutes) of up to 200ppm can be allowed under exceptional circumstances. CO is toxic by inhalation and can cause serious damage to heath. Accordingly, a meter, capable of measuring these limits, must be on board. Full enclosed space entry procedures as detailed in the&nbsp;SEM&nbsp;must also be followed with additional checks made for CO. Failure to follow these precautions may result in fatalities.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Use the 4 runner portable gas instrument to measure O2/&nbsp;HC/ CO/ H2S with ventilation STOPPED.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">In such cases, all Enclosed Space Entry Procedures and precautions must be adhered to.&nbsp;</span><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">While&nbsp;squeegeing&nbsp;veg oils the vent fans must be run and steam coils put off. Oxidizing and&nbsp;putrifying&nbsp;veg/ animal oils are dangerous for the sweeper. For high MP cargoes in winter, the crew must do this job FAST, and in a intelligent manner ,or the cold vent air will cause&nbsp;clingage&nbsp;, and&nbsp;unpumpables, which will cause surveyor to demand fresh intake of hot cargo and redoing the whole job a second time.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">For cargoes which require \u201csqueezing\u201d (sweeping), it is essential that correct voyage and discharge temperatures are maintained and that the tank bottoms are checked for hard factions in ample time before arrival at the discharge port.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Providing that the vessel arrives with the correct discharge temperature, heating should be gradually reduced when the discharge is commenced and finally shut off when the tank is&nbsp;approximately&nbsp;\u00be empty (this is important to prevent burning of the cargo as the heating coils become exposed).<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">At least one hour before the&nbsp;commencement&nbsp;of \u201csqueezing\u201d (sweeping) operations, the air blowers must be put on the tank to ensure a safe atmosphere during the operations. Special attention must be paid to the possibility of CO (Carbon Monoxide) being present in tanks which have contained Coconut Oils and the CO content of the tanks prior to and during \u201csqueezing\u201d (sweeping) operations must be monitored (this, in addition to&nbsp;LEL, O2, H2S) and mechanical ventilation of the tanks must be effective and in continuous operation throughout.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">All Enclosed Space Entry precautions and procedures must be in place prior to personnel entering the tank(s).<o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: yellow; background-image: initial; background-origin: initial; color: red; line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">A risk assessment form must be completed.&nbsp;</span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: yellow; background-image: initial; background-origin: initial; color: red; line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\"><br />\n</span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: yellow; background-image: initial; background-origin: initial; color: red; line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">USE A MATRIX OF&nbsp;</span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: yellow; background-image: initial; background-origin: initial; color: red; line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\"><br />\n</span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: yellow; background-image: initial; background-origin: initial; color: red; line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">SEVERITY-- VERSUS PERIOD OF IMPACT/ CERTAINTY</span></span></i><i><span style=\"color: red; line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"color: red; line-height: 115%;\"></span></i><i><span style=\"color: black; line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">-- </span></span><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">your company RISK ASSESSMENT form may be a bullshit form&nbsp;</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\"><br />\n</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">with a capital B --&nbsp;</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\"><br />\n</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">you as a responsible Captain or Chief officer or&nbsp;OOW&nbsp;need to&nbsp;</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\"><br />\n</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">protect your crew NOT keep an external auditor and your own&nbsp;</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">company S&amp;Q dept happy.&nbsp;</span></span></span></i><span style=\"color: black; line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\"><br />\n</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"color: blue;\"><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-size: large;\">Remember there might be Carbon Monoxide inside the tank, the&nbsp;</span></span></span></i></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt;
